pages.text: Pneumodesmus is a prehistoric myriapod known from a single specimen found in Scotland. It looked similar to modern myriapods and had a long body and slender legs. Although it resembled a millipede, it did not belong to the same branch as modern millipedes and it is the oldest known myriapod, as well as one of the first oxygen breathing animals on land.
